definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: Should the raw flesh change and turn white, he must go to the priest.
sentences.chinese: 紅肉若復原，又變白了，他就要來見祭司。

sentences.english: Joshua therefore commanded the priests, saying, Come ye up out of Jordan.
sentences.chinese: 你吩咐擡法櫃的祭司從約旦河裏上來。

sentences.english: More than 550 priests were on hand to distribute  communion to the participants.
sentences.chinese: 有550多個祭司當時在那裏給神父在分發聖餐。

sentences.english: And he gathered together all the princes of Israel， with the priests and the Levites.
sentences.chinese: 大衛招聚以色列的衆首領和祭司利未人。

sentences.english: And as Peter was beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest
sentences.chinese: 彼得在下邊，院子裏，來了大祭司的一個使女。

sentences.english: And if it spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.
sentences.chinese: 若在皮上發散開了，祭司就要定他爲不潔淨，是災病。

sentences.english: Bring the tribe of Levi and present them to Aaron the priest to assist him.
sentences.chinese: 你使利未支派近前來，站在祭司亞倫面前好服事他。

sentences.english: So the Levites made preparations for themselves and for the Aaronic priests.
sentences.chinese: 所以利未人爲自己和祭司亞倫的子孫，預備祭物。

sentences.english: And the high priest arose, and said unto him, Answerest thou nothing?
sentences.chinese: 大祭司就站起來，對耶穌說，你什麼都不回答嗎。

sentences.english: Neither shall any priest drink wine, when they enter into the inner court.
sentences.chinese: 祭司進內院的時候都不可喝酒。

sentences.english: The maenad on the right is playing a tambourine.
sentences.chinese: 而神像右邊的女祭司正演奏著小手鼓。

sentences.english: The inmost court was where the priests alone could enter to offer sacrifices.
sentences.chinese: 至於最內部的院，只有祭司纔可進到裏面去獻祭。

sentences.english: All the towns for the priests, the descendants of Aaron, were thirteen, together with their pasturelands.
sentences.chinese: 亞倫子孫作祭司的共有十三座城，還有屬城的郊野。

sentences.english: He burned the bones of the priests on their altars, and so he purged Judah and Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 將他們祭司的骸骨燒在壇上，潔淨了猶大和耶路撒冷。

sentences.english: And they that stood by said, Revilest thou God's high priest?
sentences.chinese: 站在旁邊的人說，你辱罵神的大祭司嗎。

sentences.english: Hangui is the priest of the Pumi nationality.
sentences.chinese: 韓規古籍是普米族祭司韓規使用的宗教典籍。

definition: to perform the sacrificial rites at a funeral
Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
